qas.question: When was the phoneme as a concept introduced?
Who was Jan Baudouin de Courtenay's student?
Who was influenced by  Jan Baudouin de Courtenay?
When was allophony as a concept introduced?
Who was Jan Baudouin de Courtenay's father?
Who was influenced by Mikolaj Kruszewski?

context: The <a2_0><b7_0>Polish<b7_0/><a2_0/> <a3_0><b8_0>scholar<b8_0/><a3_0/> Jan Baudouin de Courtenay (together with his former student <a1_0><b6_0>Mikołaj Kruszewski<b6_0/><a1_0/>) introduced the concept of the phoneme in <a0_0><b5_0>1876<b5_0/><a0_0/>, and his work, though often unacknowledged, is considered to be the starting point of modern phonology. He also worked on the theory of phonetic alternations (what is now called allophony and morphophonology), and had a significant influence on the work of <a4_0><b9_0>Ferdinand de Saussure<b9_0/><a4_0/>.
